conclusion: Shadows will shift and change in size based on the relative positions and angles of the objects to the light source.
As the light source moves right, the shadows will shift to the left because shadows are cast opposite the light source.
The size of the shadows will depend on the angle of the light, potentially becoming elongated or more pronounced.
The shadow of the cake (A) will move to the left and may become slightly elongated.
The shadow of the envelope (B) will move to the left, and if upright, the shadow may stretch.
The shadow of the scroll (C) will shift left and might elongate due to its cylindrical shape.
The shadow of the soccer ball (D) will move left and might elongate if the light hits it at an angle.
All shadows will shift leftward, and some may appear longer or change shape slightly.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the left and may elongate or change shape slightly.
